text: _Team *Prospela Students (beta)* joined the shared channel_

_@wavelets.joshua has joined the channel_
_@chrishcarter has joined the channel_

Hey Joshua, please meet Chris your incredible E-Mentor I've been telling you about :smile:.  Feel free to introduce yourselves, say a little bit about what you would like to get out of the mentorship and continue chatting within this channel. :wave:

I will now be leaving the channel, but please direct message myself or emma-prospela if you have any questions. All the best for now! :slightly_smiling_face:
_@dexter has left the channel_
_@dexter has left the channel_
Hey Chris, my name is Josh. I'm from Northern Ireland and I've just finished my second year at Staffordshire University studying Animation :)
Hi Josh, I'm currently a Technical Director for the 2D series pipeline at Blue Zoo (an aniamtion studio in London)
I'm working from home today, so there's a chance I might get called away to fix something at work without warning
I've heard of Blue zoo it seems like a good place to work. and I tried to get an internship there this summer but I wasn't successful.
It's pretty cool that you can work from home as well :blush:
yea, its a lovely place to work. A bit chaotic but lots of nice people and the show I'm working on i genuinely enjoy
What show are you working on? (Or are you not allowed to say?)
well a lot of my role is software/tool development and that is easier to do from home without people coming over to ask me questions
its only one day a week and Im in the studio for the other 4 days
its currently quite unusual to work from home unless you are script writer / storyboard artist or programmer
Saves you commuting into work and wasting time, it's also better for the environment :blush:
yep yep. Motivation can be a problem tho, some days I need to be around other people that are being productive and have colleagues to bounce ideas off of.
Ive worked from home full time before and did not enjoy that
so, tell me a bit about yourself. What kind of thing do you want to be doing in 3-5 years time? what do you enjoy doing the most now?

Well I've been animating since I was 10 years old (stop motion) I did my GCSE'S and A levels and then worked in an Animation studio in Belfast called Flickerpix. I went to Uni to study game animation but the course wasn't great so last year I switched over to just Animation and that's been a lot better. I want to graduate and get a good job so I can save up and buy a Narrowboat to live on. I also freelance on Upwork on the side :grin:
<https://vimeo.com/330040445>

attachments.title: Updated Showreel 2019
attachments.video_html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/330040445?autoplay=1&app_id=122963" width="400" height="225" frameborder="0" title="Updated Showreel 2019" allow="autoplay; fullscreen" allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: Here's my general showreel.
I work in After Effects but would love to learn Toon Boom and 3D in the future.
cool, thanks for showing me
No problem :blush:
do you have a specific studio / job title you will be aiming for after graduating?
I say this because I think you might have the same problem I had when I graduated. I was too much of a generalist
It made the first couple of years quite tough and lots of short contracts without much stability
No not really. I do like motion graphics and lean more that way though.
I'd recommend you look at the work being produced by specific studios that you admire / would like to work at
Ok.
The work in your showreel should be the same quality as the stuff that they produce.
Yeah that makes sense.
You can get lucky, but most of the time, studios are not going to be able to train you on the job, you will be expected to hit the ground running
They are often prepared to take a risk if you prove that you can do a similar job in different software tho.
( lots of the time we hire animators without harmony experience as their animation is very good and they have made steps to start learning it themselves )
Yeah, I know I haven't got a great deal of experience in the industry and it really worry's me that I'm going to graduate and not get a job that I want :disappointed:
Well I have a lot of experience in After Effects but I know that harmony seems to be the way to go.
I would not get too worried about the specific software ( unless you are wanting to get into rigging )
Yeah I'm not really sure what I want to do to be honest :sweat_smile:
would you say you want to aim more towards character animation, FX, motion graphics, directing or art direction
Probably motion graphics because of After Effects, being a Director would be a dream but I don't even know how I'd even get into that.
Is there anywhere that I can check out what your 3rd year curriculum would be at Staffordshire?
ah cool, thats great that you are aiming high!
Um... I think I can check out what modules I have give me a second :grin:

So my modules for next year are...

Individual Short Animation: 30 Credits
Animation Future Destinations: 15 Credits
Final Major Signature Project: 60 Credits
Animation Declarations: 15 Credits
Animation Declarations is a 3000 word Harvard referenced essay on a subject of your choice.
Animation future destinations is I think brushing up on your CV and reel while learning how to apply for jobs.

I found this page:
<http://www.staffs.ac.uk/course/animation-ba>

attachments.title: Animation
attachments.text: Do you have a favourite character from an animated film? Whether it’s Buzz Lightyear, a minion from Despicable Me, Jack Skellington or one of the Disney princesses, have you ever wondered what and who turns them into such likeable (or loathe-able) characters?

text: is that the course that you are on?
<http://www.staffs.ac.uk/course/animation-ba|www.staffs.ac.uk/course/animation-ba>
This is the course I'm on
ah, just realising that you are on summer holiday now and wont have coursework for a while now :stuck_out_tongue:
whats your summer plans?
Well I applied all over the UK and Ireland for internships and got nothing back :joy:
oh no :disappointed:
I then tried to get back into Flickerpix to work there but they've downsized and don't have anything for me :blush:
we could figure out some short project for the next couple of weeks if you have time for that?
Yeah that would be cool. I was also thinking about coming up with ideas for my Final project next year :grin:
Is your final project indidual or group?
*individual
Final year project, you can work with other people but most don't. You also get a second year to help you for a bit (25 hours worth)
when do you start back at uni? and when do you have to have your proposal for your final year project for?
I start back at the end of September. I do the individual Short Animation module for the first few months before launching into the FMP
The module description says you negotiate with your lecturers with the scale and depth of your final piece so I don't think there's an official start date.
Oh sure, that makes sense.
Well the way most internships work at Blue Zoo is the interns work together to make a short film
Well I do have an idea for a short film :blush:
I think we are expected to make a Bible with all our preproduction as well to back up our work.
How short a film? ( runtime )
Between 5 and 10 minutes most likely. Probably closer to 5.
eeeek thats quite long
Haha I know! :grin:
Maybe 3 minutes then :grin:
its possible but I'd highly recommend you aim for somethign nearer 3 mins unless the art direction is intentionally econimical
so do you have something worked up currently? a proposal or outline or artwork?
I have a good outline in my head and a working title. :blush:
*economical
oh cool. well if thats what you want to be working towards this summer I can help you figure out some goals and review your work
Yeah that would be awesome :grin:
I'll right out my outline and you can tell me what you think of it.
sure, but just so you know what I was thinking of doing otherwise, you make some very short form content for things like 11 second club / loopdeloop ( or other online competition things )
I have done stuff for the 11 second club before (not very good stuff though) :grin:
you can do both ( if you have time )
Yeah I have time
<https://vimeo.com/305716195>

attachments.title: My 11 Second Club November
attachments.fallback: Vimeo Video: My 11 Second Club November
attachments.video_html: <iframe src="https://player.vimeo.com/video/305716195?autoplay=1&app_id=122963" width="400" height="225" frameborder="0" title="My 11 Second Club November" allow="autoplay; fullscreen" allowfullscreen></iframe>

text: but you seem to be pumped for your short film so lets run with that for now :slightly_smiling_face:
We did it as an exercise to teach us lip syncing.
not bad. very minimal. The lipsync is fine.
I feel you could have pushed the posing/acting more. But as lipsync it does the job
Yeah it was only a very small part of the module and the emphasis was in the lip sync :/
I think it would be good if we set up weekly catchups. ( feel free to chat here more often tho but I'm not sure how regularly I'll be able to check it)
But as we have only just met I think it would be helpful to have a chat in a couple of days time also
I'd like to give you a couple of assignments.
That's ok :blush:

1. Write up an outline for your short film ( this should fit on 1 A4 page, 300 words or so ). If you have any artwork to go with it that would be good to see also.
2. Do some research on short animation competitions and see if there are any with a deadline before September 1st that you would like to enter ( something like <https://www.loopdeloop.org/> maybe ? )

attachments.title: LoopdeLoop
attachments.text: LoopdeLoop is an international animation challenge and a community of creative folks working...

text: How is this thursday afternoon for catching up with eachother? ( 7pm?)
But in general Tuesday Lunchtime is good for me for our weekly chats if it is good for you too
That all sounds good, Thursdays are grand. I can talk whenever. If you want I can keep you updated as I go and if you're busy just reply when you can :blush:
nice one :slightly_smiling_face:
Its been nice chatting with you Josh, I'm excited to see what we will both learn this summer :slightly_smiling_face:
Me too :blush:
Thankyou for taking the time to help me :blush:
